Detailed Description

Base component class.

Components are special objects that can be attached to SceneNodes. Components are created by the SceneManager through ComponentCreators and should never be created manually.

Component * Component::copy ( const std::string &  name  ) 

Create a copy of the Component.

This method wraps SceneManager->CopyComponent.

Parameters:
name Name of the new Component, if name is already in use the previously existing Component will be returned.

void Component::destroy ( const bool  deleteIfInUse  )  [virtual]

Destroys the Component.

Wraps SceneManager::destroyComponent.

Parameters:
deleteIfInUse If this parameter is false, the Component will not be destroyed if it has any users.

virtual void Component::notifyRemoved ( SceneNode *  node  )  [inline, virtual]

Notifies the Component that it has been attached to a SceneNode.

This method is an internal method and should not be called directly.

Parameters:
node SceneNode the Camera has been removed from.

Reimplemented in CompoundRenderable.

Definition at line 92 of file Component.h.

virtual void Component::registerUser ( SceneNode *  node  )  [inline, virtual]

Notifies the Component that it has been attached to a SceneNode.

This method can be overriden to change how many SceneNode's can use the Component. This method is an internal method and should not be called directly.

Parameters:
node SceneNode the Component has been attached to.

Reimplemented in Camera, and CompoundRenderable.

void Component::removeUser ( SceneNode *  node  )  [virtual]

Remove the Component from the passed SceneNode This method can be overriden for different behavior.

Parameters:
node The node from which the Component should be removed, nothing happens if the Component is not attached to node.
